post.description: This endpoint can take planar 2D line objects and enrich them with elevation from a variety of datasets. The input and output formats are: * GeoJSON * Polyline * Google's Encoded polyline with coordinate precision 5 or 6 Example: ``` # POST LineString as polyline curl -XPOST https://api.openrouteservice.org/elevation/line -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -H 'Authorization: INSERT_YOUR_KEY -d '{ "format_in": "polyline", "format_out": "encodedpolyline5", "geometry": [[13.349762, 38.112952], [12.638397, 37.645772]] }' ```

dataset.description: The elevation dataset to be used.

format_in.description: The input format the API has to expect.

format_out.description: The output format to be returned.

geometry.description: * geojson: A geometry object of a LineString GeoJSON, e.g. {"type": "LineString", "coordinates": [[13.331302, 38.108433],[13.331273, 38.10849]] } * polyline: A list of coordinate lists, e.g. [[13.331302, 38.108433], [13.331273, 38.10849]] * encodedpolyline5: A Google encoded polyline with a coordinate precision of 5, e.g. u`rgFswjpAKD * encodedpolyline6: A Google encoded polyline with a coordinate precision of 6, e.g. ap}tgAkutlXqBx@

requestBody.description: Query the elevation of a line in various formats.

200.description: Standard response for successfully processed requests.

500.description:
An unexpected error was encountered and more detailed internal
errorcode is provided.
| Internal Code | Description                                        |
|:-------------:|----------------------------------------------------|
| 4001 |  ValueError in parameters |
| 4002 |  Wrong HTTP headers |
| 4003 |  Problems with the provided geometry |
| 4004 |  Exceeded the number of allowed vertices |

get.description:
This endpoint can take a 2D point and enrich it with elevation from a variety of datasets.

The output formats are:
  * GeoJSON
  * Point

Example:
```
  # GET point
  curl -XGET https://localhost:5000/elevation/point?geometry=13.349762,38.11295
```

parameters.description: Insert your API Key here.
parameters.name: api_key

parameters.description: The point to be queried, in comma-separated lon,lat values, e.g. [13.349762, 38.11295]
parameters.name: geometry

parameters.description: The output format to be returned.
parameters.name: format_out

parameters.description: The elevation dataset to be used.
parameters.name: dataset

200.description: Standard response for successfully processed requests.

500.description:
An unexpected error was encountered and more detailed internal
error code is provided.
| Internal Code | Description                                        |
|:-------------:|----------------------------------------------------|
| 4001 |  ValueError in parameters |
| 4002 |  Wrong HTTP headers |
| 4003 |  Problems with the provided geometry |
| 4004 |  Exceeded the number of allowed vertices |

post.description:
This endpoint can take a 2D point and enrich it with elevation from a variety of datasets.

The input and output formats are:
  * GeoJSON
  * Point

Example:
```
  # POST point as GeoJSON
  # https://api.openrouteservice.org/elevation/point?api_key=YOUR-KEY
  {
    "format_in": "geojson",
    "format_out": "geojson",
    "geometry": {
      "coordinates": [13.349762, 38.11295],
      "type": "Point"
    }
  }
```

dataset.description: The elevation dataset to be used.

format_in.description: The input format the API has to expect.

format_out.description: The output format to be returned.

geometry.description:
* geojson: A geometry object of a Point GeoJSON, e.g.
         {"type": "Point",
          "coordinates": [13.331273, 38.10849]
         }
* point: A coordinate list, e.g.
         [13.331273, 38.10849]

requestBody.description: Query the elevation of a point in various formats.

200.description: Standard response for successfully processed requests.

500.description:
An unexpected error was encountered and more detailed internal
errorcode is provided.
| Internal Code | Description                                        |
|:-------------:|----------------------------------------------------|
| 4001 |  ValueError in parameters |
| 4002 |  Wrong HTTP headers |
| 4003 |  Problems with the provided geometry |
| 4004 |  Exceeded the number of allowed vertices |

Restrict your search to specific sources. Searches all sources by default. You can either use the normal or short name.
Sources are [`openstreetmap(osm)`](http://www.openstreetmap.org/), [`openaddresses(oa)`](http://openaddresses.io/), [`whosonfirst(wof)`](https://whosonfirst.org/), [`geonames(gn)`](http://www.geonames.org/).

parameters.description:
Restrict search to layers (place type). By default all layers are searched.
  layer|description|
  ----|----|
  `venue`|points of interest, businesses, things with walls|
  `address`|places with a street address|
  `street`|streets,roads,highways|
  `neighbourhood`|social communities, neighbourhoods|
  `borough`|a local administrative boundary, currently only used for New York City|
  `localadmin`|local administrative boundaries|
  `locality`|towns, hamlets, cities|
  `county`|official governmental area; usually bigger than a locality, almost always smaller than a region|
  `macrocounty`|a related group of counties. Mostly in Europe.|
  `region`|states and provinces|
  `macroregion`|a related group of regions. Mostly in Europe|
  `country`|places that issue passports, nations, nation-states|
  `coarse`|alias for simultaneously using all administrative layers (everything except `venue` and `address`)|
parameters.name: layers

post.description:
The optimization endpoint solves [Vehicle Routing Problems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vehicle_routing_problem) and can be used to schedule multiple vehicles and jobs, respecting time windows, capacities and required skills.

This service is based on the excellent [Vroom project](https://github.com/VROOM-Project/vroom). Please also consult its [API documentation](https://github.com/VROOM-Project/vroom/blob/master/docs/API.md).

General Info:
- The expected order for all coordinates arrays is `[lon, lat]`
- All timings are in seconds
- All distances are in meters
- A `time_window` object is a pair of timestamps in the form `[start, end]`

jobs.description: Array of `job` objects describing the places to visit. For a detailed object description visit the [VROOM api description](https://github.com/VROOM-Project/vroom/blob/master/docs/API.md#jobs)

items.description:
If a custom matrix is provided:
- `location_index` is mandatory
- `location` is optional but can be set to retrieve coordinates in the response

If no custom matrix is provided:
- a `matrix` query will be sent to ORS
- `location` is mandatory
- `location_index` is irrelevant

delivery.description: an array of integers describing multidimensional quantities for delivery

id.description: an integer used as unique identifier

location.description: coordinates array in `[lon, lat]`

location_index.description: index of relevant row and column in custom matrix

pickup.description: an array of integers describing multidimensional quantities for pickup

priority.description: an integer in the range [0, 100] describing priority level (defaults to 0)

service.description: job service duration (defaults to 0), in seconds

setup.description: job setup duration (defaults to 0), in seconds

skills.description: Array of integers defining mandatory skills for this job

time_windows.description:
Array of `time_window` arrays describing valid slots for job service start and end,
in week seconds, i.e. 28800 = Mon, 8 AM.

matrices.description:
The matrices object allows to input (non-empty) custom matrices for each vehicle profile.

If only the durations matrix is provided, internal costs are derived from durations based on vehicles costs properties.

If custom matrices are provided for all required vehicle profile values, the location, start and end properties become optional.
Instead of the coordinates, row and column indications provided with the *_index keys are used during optimization.

cycling-electric.description: Contains `durations`, `distances` or `cost` matrices for a profile

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

cycling-mountain.description: Contains `durations`, `distances` or `cost` matrices for a profile

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

cycling-regular.description: Contains `durations`, `distances` or `cost` matrices for a profile

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

foot-walking.description: Contains `durations`, `distances` or `cost` matrices for a profile

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

wheelchair.description: Contains `durations`, `distances` or `cost` matrices for a profile

costs.description: costs for a custom cost matrix that will be used within all route cost evaluations

distances.description: distances for a custom distance matrix

durations.description: Durations for a custom travel-time matrix that will be used for all checks against timing constraints

options.description: Additional options passed to the optimization engine.

g.description: Calculate geometries for the optimized routes.

vehicles.description: Array of `vehicle` objects describing the available vehicles. For a detailed object description visit the [VROOM API description](https://github.com/VROOM-Project/vroom/blob/master/docs/API.md#vehicles)

items.description: A vehicle object with capacity, time windows and skills.

id.description: Integer used as unique identifier

max_load.description:
Array of integers describing the maximum vehicle load for which this break can happen.
An error is reported if two break objects have the same id for the same vehicle.

time_windows.description:
Array of time_window objects describing valid slots for break start and end,
in week seconds, i.e. 28800 = Mon, 8 AM.

capacity.description: Array of integers describing multidimensional quantities.

fixed.description: integer defining the cost of using this vehicle in the solution (defaults to 0)

per_hour.description: integer defining the cost for one hour of travel time with this vehicle (defaults to 3600)

per_km.description: integer defining the cost for one km of travel time with this vehicle (defaults to 0)

end.description:
End coordinates array in `[lon, lat]` format. If left blank, the optimization
engine will identify the optimal end point.

end_index.description: Index of relevant row and column in custom matrix.

id.description: Integer used as unique identifier

max_distance.description: an integer defining the maximum distance for this vehicle

max_tasks.description: an integer defining the maximum number of tasks in a route for this vehicle

max_travel_time.description: an integer defining the maximum travel time for this vehicle

profile.description: The ORS routing profile for the vehicle.

skills.description: Array of integers defining skills for this vehicle

speed_factor.description:
A double value in the range (0, 5] used to scale all vehicle travel times (defaults to 1.).
The respected precision is limited to two digits after the decimal point.

start.description:
Start coordinates array in `[lon, lat]` format. If left blank, the optimization
engine will identify the optimal start point.

start_index.description: Index of relevant row and column in custom matrix.

id.description: id of the task to be performed at this step if `type` value is not `start` or `end`

service_after.description: hard constraint on service time lower bound (as absolute or relative timestamp)

service_at.description: hard constraint on service time (as absolute or relative timestamp)

service_before.description: hard constraint on service time upper bound (as absolute or relative timestamp)

type.description: step type (either start, job, pickup, delivery, break or end)]

time_window.description:
A `time_window` array describing working hours for this vehicle,
in week seconds, i.e. 28800 = Mon, 8 AM.

requestBody.description: The request body of the optimization request.

code.description:
status code. Possible values:

 Value         | Status |
 :-----------: | :-----------: |
 `0` | no error raised |
 `1` | internal error |
 `2` | input error |
 `3` | routing error |

error.description: error message (present if `code` is different from `0`)

delivery.description: Total delivery for tasks in this route

description.description: vehicle description, if provided in input

distance.description: total route distance. Only provided when using the `-g` flag

duration.description: total travel time for this route

geometry.description: polyline encoded route geometry. Only provided when using the `-g` flag

pickup.description: total pickup for tasks in this route

service.description: total service time for this route

arrival.description: estimated time of arrival at this step in seconds

description.description: step description, if provided in input

distance.description: traveled distance upon arrival at this step. Only provided when using the `-g` flag

duration.description: cumulated travel time upon arrival at this step in seconds

id.description: id of the task performed at this step, only provided if type value is `job`, `pickup`, `delivery` or `break`

load.description: vehicle load after step completion (with capacity constraints)

location.description: coordinates array for this step (if provided in input)

violations.description: array of violation objects for this step

items.description:
Note on violations: reporting only really makes sense when using -c to choose ETA for custom routes described in input using the steps keys for a vehicle.
When using regular optimization, violations are still reported for consistency, but are guaranteed to be "void", i.e. violations arrays are empty.

cause.description:
string describing the cause of violation.
Possible violation causes are:
            - "delay" if actual service start does not meet a task time window and is late on a time window end
            - "lead_time" if actual service start does not meet a task time window and is early on a time window start
            - "load" if the vehicle load goes over its capacity
            - "max_tasks" if the vehicle has more tasks than its max_tasks value
            - "skills" if the vehicle does not hold all required skills for a task
            - "precedence" if a shipment precedence constraint is not met (pickup without matching delivery, delivery before/without matching pickup)
            - "missing_break" if a vehicle break has been omitted in its custom route
            - "max_travel_time" if the vehicle has more travel time than its max_travel_time value
            - "max_load" if the load during a break exceed its max_load value

duration.description: Earliness (resp. lateness) if `cause` is "lead_time" (resp "delay")

waiting_time.description: waiting time upon arrival at this step, only provided if `type` value is `job`

vehicle.description: id of the vehicle assigned to this route

waiting_time.description: total waiting time for this route

distance.description: total distance for all routes. Only provided when using the `-g` flag with `OSRM`

duration.description: total travel time for all routes

priority.description: total priority sum for all assigned tasks

routes.description: Number of routes in the solution

service.description: total service time for all routes

setup.description: Total setup time for all routes

unassigned.description: number of jobs that could not be served

violations.description: array of violation objects for all routes

items.description:
Note on violations: reporting only really makes sense when using -c to choose ETA for custom routes described in input using the steps keys for a vehicle.
When using regular optimization, violations are still reported for consistency, but are guaranteed to be "void", i.e. violations arrays are empty.

cause.description:
string describing the cause of violation.

            - "delay" if actual service start does not meet a task time window and is late on a time window end
            - "lead_time" if actual service start does not meet a task time window and is early on a time window start
            - "load" if the vehicle load goes over its capacity
            - "max_tasks" if the vehicle has more tasks than its max_tasks value
            - "skills" if the vehicle does not hold all required skills for a task
            - "precedence" if a shipment precedence constraint is not met (pickup without matching delivery, delivery before/without matching pickup)
            - "missing_break" if a vehicle break has been omitted in its custom route
            - "max_travel_time" if the vehicle has more travel time than its max_travel_time value
            - "max_load" if the load during a break exceed its max_load value

duration.description: Earliness (resp. lateness) if `cause` is "lead_time" (resp "delay")

waiting_time.description: total waiting time for all routes

unassigned.description: array of objects describing unassigned jobs with their `id` and `location` (if provided)

items.description: Unassigned Job with `id` and `location` (if provided)

id.description: The `id` of the unassigned job"

location.description: The `location` of the unassigned job

200.description: Valid response if code contains `0`

500.description:
An unexpected error was encountered and more detailed internal
error code is provided.
| Internal Code | Description  |
|:-:|--------------------------|
| 1 |  Internal Vroom error    |
| 2 |  Error in input          |
| 3 |  Routing error in ORS    |
| 4 |  Request too large       |

post.description:
Returns points of interest in the area surrounding a geometry which can either be a bounding box, polygon or buffered linestring or point.
Find more examples on [github](https://github.com/GIScience/openpoiservice).

filters.description: Filters in terms of osm_tags which should be applied to the query.

name.description: Filter by name of the poi object.

geometry.description: The geometry object which is a geojson or a bounding box object, optionally buffered.

bbox.description: The pattern for this bbox string is minlon,minlat,maxlon,maxlat

geojson.description: This is a GeoJSON object. Is either Point, Polygon or LineString.

limit.description: The limit of objects to be returned in the response.

sortby.description: Either you can sort by category or the distance to the geometry object provided in the request.

200.description: Standard response for successfully processed requests.

400.description:
The request was invalid, and more detailed internal errorcode is provided.
| Internal Code | Description                                        |
|:-------------:|----------------------------------------------------|
| 4000 |  Invalid JSON object in request |
| 4001 |  Category or category group ids missing |
| 4002 |  Geometry is missing |
| 4003 |  Bounding box and or geojson not present in request |
| 4004 |  Buffer is missing |
| 4005 |  Geometry length does not meet the restrictions |
| 4006 |  Unsupported HTTP method |
| 4007 |  GeoJSON parsing error |
| 4008 |  Geometry size does not meet the restrictions |
| 4009 |  Unsupported Content-Type |

get.description: Get a basic route between two points with the profile provided. Returned response is in GeoJSON format. This method does not accept any request body or parameters other than profile, start coordinate, and end coordinate.

parameters.description: Specifies the route profile.
parameters.name: profile

parameters.description: Start coordinate of the route in `longitude,latitude` format.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Destination coordinate of the route in `longitude,latitude` format.
parameters.name: end

bbox.description: Bounding box that covers all returned routes

items.description: Bounding box that covers all returned routes

engine.description: Information about the openrouteservice engine used

build_date.description: The date that the service was last updated

graph_date.description: The date that the graph data was last updated

version.description: The backend version of the openrouteservice that was queried

id.description: ID of the request (as passed in by the query)

osm_file_md5_hash.description: The MD5 hash of the OSM planet file that was used for generating graphs

query.description: The JSON body request sent to the routing service which defines options and parameters regarding the route to generate.

alternative_routes.description: Specifies whether alternative routes are computed, and parameters for the algorithm determining suitable alternatives.

share_factor.description: Maximum fraction of the route that alternatives may share with the optimal route. The default value of 0.6 means alternatives can share up to 60% of path segments with the optimal route.

target_count.description: Target number of alternative routes to compute. Service returns up to this number of routes that fulfill the share-factor and weight-factor constraints.

weight_factor.description: Maximum factor by which route weight may diverge from the optimal route. The default value of 1.4 means alternatives can be up to 1.4 times longer (costly) than the optimal route.

alternative_routes.title: Alternative Routes

items.description: List of route attributes

bearings.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.
"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

items.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.
"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

elevation.description: Specifies whether to return elevation values for points. Please note that elevation also gets encoded for json response encoded polyline.

extra_info.description: The extra info items to include in the response

items.description: Specify which extra info items to include in the response

geometry_simplify.description: Specifies whether to simplify the geometry. Simplify geometry cannot be applied to routes with more than **one segment** and when `extra_info` is required.

id.description: Arbitrary identification string of the request reflected in the meta information.

ignore_transfers.description: Specifies if transfers as criterion should be ignored.

instructions_format.description: Select html for more verbose instructions.

maneuvers.description: Specifies whether the maneuver object is included into the step object or not.

maximum_speed.description: The maximum speed specified by user.

avoid_borders.description: Specify which type of border crossing to avoid

avoid_countries.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.

items.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.
Definition of the features to be avoided.

additionalProperties.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

avoid_polygons.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

profile_params.description: Specifies additional routing parameters. For all profiles except `driving-car`.

allow_unsuitable.description: Specifies if ways that might not be suitable (e.g. unknown pedestrian usage) should be included in finding routes - default false

restrictions.description: Describe restrictions to be applied to edges on the routing. any edges that do not match these restrictions are not traversed.

hazmat.description: Specifies whether to use appropriate routing for delivering hazardous goods and avoiding water protected areas. Default is `false`.

maximum_incline.description: Specifies the maximum incline as a percentage. `3`, `6` (default), `10`, `15.

maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in metres. Values are `0.03`, `0.06` (default), `0.1`.

minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres.

smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Default is `good`.

surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Default is `sett`.

track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Default is `grade1`.

surface_quality_known.description: Specifies whether to enforce that only ways with known information on surface quality be taken into account - default false

weightings.description: Describe additional weightings to be applied to edges on the routing.

green.description:
Specifies the Green factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the green routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through green areas over a shorter route.

quiet.description:
Specifies the Quiet factor for foot-* profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the quiet routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer quiet ways over a shorter route.

shadow.description:
Specifies the shadow factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the shadow routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through shadow areas over a shorter route.

steepness_difficulty.description:
Specifies the fitness level for `cycling-*` profiles.

 level: 0 = Novice, 1 = Moderate, 2 = Amateur, 3 = Pro. The prefered gradient increases with level.

weightings.title: Profile Weightings

profile_params.title: Profile Parameters

round_trip.description: Specifies the parameters for generating round trip routes.

length.description: The target length of the route in `m` (note that this is a preferred value, but results may be different).

points.description: The number of points to use on the route. Larger values create more circular routes.

seed.description: A seed to use for adding randomisation to the overall direction of the generated route

round_trip.title: Round Trip Route Options

radiuses.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

items.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

roundabout_exits.description: Provides bearings of the entrance and all passed roundabout exits. Adds the `exit_bearings` array to the step object in the response.

schedule.description: If true, return a public transport schedule starting at <departure> for the next <schedule_duration> minutes.

schedule_duration.description: The time window when requesting a public transport schedule. The format is passed as ISO 8601 duration: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

schedule_rows.description: The maximum amount of entries that should be returned when requesting a schedule.

skip_segments.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

items.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

suppress_warnings.description: Suppress warning messages in the response

walking_time.description: Maximum duration for walking access and egress of public transport. The value is passed in ISO 8601 duration format: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

timestamp.description: Time that the request was made (UNIX Epoch time)

200.description: Standard response for successfully processed requests. Returns GeoJSON. The decoded values of the extra information can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/extra-info/Extra-Info.html).

400.description: The request is incorrect and therefore can not be processed.

404.description: An element could not be found. If possible, a more detailed error code is provided.

405.description: The specified HTTP method is not supported. For more details, refer to the EndPoint documentation.

413.description: The request is larger than the server is able to process, the data provided in the request exceeds the capacity limit.

500.description: An unexpected error was encountered and a more detailed error code is provided.

501.description: Indicates that the server does not support the functionality needed to fulfill the request.

503.description: The server is currently unavailable due to overload or maintenance.

"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.

profile_params.description: Specifies additional routing parameters. For all profiles except `driving-car`.

allow_unsuitable.description: Specifies if ways that might not be suitable (e.g. unknown pedestrian usage) should be included in finding routes - default false

restrictions.description: Describe restrictions to be applied to edges on the routing. any edges that do not match these restrictions are not traversed.

hazmat.description: Specifies whether to use appropriate routing for delivering hazardous goods and avoiding water protected areas. Default is `false`.

maximum_incline.description: Specifies the maximum incline as a percentage. `3`, `6` (default), `10`, `15.

maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in metres. Values are `0.03`, `0.06` (default), `0.1`.

minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres.

smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Default is `good`.

surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Default is `sett`.

track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Default is `grade1`.

surface_quality_known.description: Specifies whether to enforce that only ways with known information on surface quality be taken into account - default false

weightings.description: Describe additional weightings to be applied to edges on the routing.

green.description:
Specifies the Green factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the green routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through green areas over a shorter route.

quiet.description:
Specifies the Quiet factor for foot-* profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the quiet routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer quiet ways over a shorter route.

shadow.description:

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the shadow routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through shadow areas over a shorter route.

round_trip.title: Round Trip Route Options

radiuses.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

items.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

roundabout_exits.description: Provides bearings of the entrance and all passed roundabout exits. Adds the `exit_bearings` array to the step object in the response.

schedule.description: If true, return a public transport schedule starting at <departure> for the next <schedule_duration> minutes.

schedule_duration.description: The time window when requesting a public transport schedule. The format is passed as ISO 8601 duration: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

schedule_rows.description: The maximum amount of entries that should be returned when requesting a schedule.

skip_segments.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

items.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

walking_time.description: Maximum duration for walking access and egress of public transport. The value is passed in ISO 8601 duration format: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

200.description: Standard response for successfully processed requests. Returns GeoJSON. The decoded values of the extra information can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/extra-info/Extra-Info.html).

404.description: An element could not be found. If possible, a more detailed error code is provided.

405.description: The specified HTTP method is not supported. For more details, refer to the EndPoint documentation.

413.description: The request is larger than the server is able to process, the data provided in the request exceeds the capacity limit.

501.description: Indicates that the server does not support the functionality needed to fulfill the request.

503.description: The server is currently unavailable due to overload or maintenance.

share_factor.description: Maximum fraction of the route that alternatives may share with the optimal route. The default value of 0.6 means alternatives can share up to 60% of path segments with the optimal route.

target_count.description: Target number of alternative routes to compute. Service returns up to this number of routes that fulfill the share-factor and weight-factor constraints.

weight_factor.description: Maximum factor by which route weight may diverge from the optimal route. The default value of 1.4 means alternatives can be up to 1.4 times longer (costly) than the optimal route.

bearings.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.
"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

post.description:
The Isochrone Service supports time and distance analyses for one single or multiple locations.
You may also specify the isochrone interval or provide multiple exact isochrone range values.
This service allows the same range of profile options as the /directions endpoint,
which help you to further customize your request to obtain a more detailed reachability area response.

smoothing.description:
Applies a level of generalisation to the isochrone polygons generated as a `smoothing_factor` between `0` and `100.0`.
Generalisation is produced by determining a maximum length of a connecting line between two points found on the outside of a containing polygon.
If the distance is larger than a threshold value, the line between the two points is removed and a smaller connecting line between other points is used.
Note that the minimum length of this connecting line is ~1333m, and so when the `smoothing_factor` results in a distance smaller than this, the minimum value is used.
The threshold value is determined as `(maximum_radius_of_isochrone / 100) * smoothing_factor`.
Therefore, a value closer to 100 will result in a more generalised shape.
The polygon generation algorithm is based on Duckham and al. (2008) `"Efficient generation of simple polygons for characterizing the shape of a set of points in the plane."`

units.description:
Specifies the distance units only if `range_type` is set to distance.

smoothing.description:
Applies a level of generalisation to the isochrone polygons generated as a `smoothing_factor` between `0` and `100.0`.
Generalisation is produced by determining a maximum length of a connecting line between two points found on the outside of a containing polygon.
If the distance is larger than a threshold value, the line between the two points is removed and a smaller connecting line between other points is used.
Note that the minimum length of this connecting line is ~1333m, and so when the `smoothing_factor` results in a distance smaller than this, the minimum value is used.
The threshold value is determined as `(maximum_radius_of_isochrone / 100) * smoothing_factor`.
Therefore, a value closer to 100 will result in a more generalised shape.
The polygon generation algorithm is based on Duckham and al. (2008) `"Efficient generation of simple polygons for characterizing the shape of a set of points in the plane."`

items.description: Maximum range value of the analysis in **seconds** for time and **metres** for distance.Alternatively a comma separated list of specific range values. Ranges will be the same for all locations.

smoothing.description:
Applies a level of generalisation to the isochrone polygons generated as a `smoothing_factor` between `0` and `100.0`.
Generalisation is produced by determining a maximum length of a connecting line between two points found on the outside of a containing polygon.
If the distance is larger than a threshold value, the line between the two points is removed and a smaller connecting line between other points is used.
Note that the minimum length of this connecting line is ~1333m, and so when the `smoothing_factor` results in a distance smaller than this, the minimum value is used.
The threshold value is determined as `(maximum_radius_of_isochrone / 100) * smoothing_factor`.
Therefore, a value closer to 100 will result in a more generalised shape.
The polygon generation algorithm is based on Duckham and al. (2008) `"Efficient generation of simple polygons for characterizing the shape of a set of points in the plane."`

units.description:
Specifies the distance units only if `range_type` is set to distance.
Default: m.

alternative_routes.description: Specifies whether alternative routes are computed, and parameters for the algorithm determining suitable alternatives.

share_factor.description: Maximum fraction of the route that alternatives may share with the optimal route. The default value of 0.6 means alternatives can share up to 60% of path segments with the optimal route.

target_count.description: Target number of alternative routes to compute. Service returns up to this number of routes that fulfill the share-factor and weight-factor constraints.

weight_factor.description: Maximum factor by which route weight may diverge from the optimal route. The default value of 1.4 means alternatives can be up to 1.4 times longer (costly) than the optimal route.

items.description: List of route attributes

bearings.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.
"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.

profile_params.description: Specifies additional routing parameters. For all profiles except `driving-car`.

allow_unsuitable.description: Specifies if ways that might not be suitable (e.g. unknown pedestrian usage) should be included in finding routes - default false

restrictions.description: Describe restrictions to be applied to edges on the routing. any edges that do not match these restrictions are not traversed.

hazmat.description: Specifies whether to use appropriate routing for delivering hazardous goods and avoiding water protected areas. Default is `false`.

maximum_incline.description: Specifies the maximum incline as a percentage. `3`, `6` (default), `10`, `15.

maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in metres. Values are `0.03`, `0.06` (default), `0.1`.

minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres.

smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Default is `good`.

surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Default is `sett`.

track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Default is `grade1`.

surface_quality_known.description: Specifies whether to enforce that only ways with known information on surface quality be taken into account - default false

weightings.description: Describe additional weightings to be applied to edges on the routing.

green.description:
Specifies the Green factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the green routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through green areas over a shorter route.

quiet.description:
Specifies the Quiet factor for foot-* profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the quiet routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer quiet ways over a shorter route.

shadow.description:
Specifies the shadow factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the shadow routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through shadow areas over a shorter route.

steepness_difficulty.description:
Specifies the fitness level for `cycling-*` profiles.

 level: 0 = Novice, 1 = Moderate, 2 = Amateur, 3 = Pro. The prefered gradient increases with level.

round_trip.title: Round Trip Route Options

radiuses.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

items.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

roundabout_exits.description: Provides bearings of the entrance and all passed roundabout exits. Adds the `exit_bearings` array to the step object in the response.

schedule.description: If true, return a public transport schedule starting at <departure> for the next <schedule_duration> minutes.

schedule_duration.description: The time window when requesting a public transport schedule. The format is passed as ISO 8601 duration: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

schedule_rows.description: The maximum amount of entries that should be returned when requesting a schedule.

skip_segments.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

items.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

suppress_warnings.description: Suppress warning messages in the response

walking_time.description: Maximum duration for walking access and egress of public transport. The value is passed in ISO 8601 duration format: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

alternative_routes.description: Specifies whether alternative routes are computed, and parameters for the algorithm determining suitable alternatives.

share_factor.description: Maximum fraction of the route that alternatives may share with the optimal route. The default value of 0.6 means alternatives can share up to 60% of path segments with the optimal route.

target_count.description: Target number of alternative routes to compute. Service returns up to this number of routes that fulfill the share-factor and weight-factor constraints.

weight_factor.description: Maximum factor by which route weight may diverge from the optimal route. The default value of 1.4 means alternatives can be up to 1.4 times longer (costly) than the optimal route.

alternative_routes.title: Alternative Routes

items.description: List of route attributes

bearings.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.
"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

geometry_simplify.description: Specifies whether to simplify the geometry. Simplify geometry cannot be applied to routes with more than **one segment** and when `extra_info` is required.

id.description: Arbitrary identification string of the request reflected in the meta information.

ignore_transfers.description: Specifies if transfers as criterion should be ignored.

instructions_format.description: Select html for more verbose instructions.

maneuvers.description: Specifies whether the maneuver object is included into the step object or not.

maximum_speed.description: The maximum speed specified by user.

avoid_borders.description: Specify which type of border crossing to avoid

avoid_countries.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.

items.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.
Definition of the features to be avoided.

additionalProperties.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

avoid_polygons.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

profile_params.description: Specifies additional routing parameters. For all profiles except `driving-car`.

allow_unsuitable.description: Specifies if ways that might not be suitable (e.g. unknown pedestrian usage) should be included in finding routes - default false

restrictions.description: Describe restrictions to be applied to edges on the routing. any edges that do not match these restrictions are not traversed.

hazmat.description: Specifies whether to use appropriate routing for delivering hazardous goods and avoiding water protected areas. Default is `false`.

maximum_incline.description: Specifies the maximum incline as a percentage. `3`, `6` (default), `10`, `15.

maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in metres. Values are `0.03`, `0.06` (default), `0.1`.

minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres.

smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Default is `good`.

surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Default is `sett`.

track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Default is `grade1`.

surface_quality_known.description: Specifies whether to enforce that only ways with known information on surface quality be taken into account - default false

weightings.description: Describe additional weightings to be applied to edges on the routing.

green.description:
Specifies the Green factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the green routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through green areas over a shorter route.

quiet.description:
Specifies the Quiet factor for foot-* profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the quiet routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer quiet ways over a shorter route.

shadow.description:
Specifies the shadow factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the shadow routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through shadow areas over a shorter route.

steepness_difficulty.description:
Specifies the fitness level for `cycling-*` profiles.

 level: 0 = Novice, 1 = Moderate, 2 = Amateur, 3 = Pro. The prefered gradient increases with level.

round_trip.description: Specifies the parameters for generating round trip routes.

length.description: The target length of the route in `m` (note that this is a preferred value, but results may be different).

points.description: The number of points to use on the route. Larger values create more circular routes.

seed.description: A seed to use for adding randomisation to the overall direction of the generated route

round_trip.title: Round Trip Route Options

radiuses.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

items.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

roundabout_exits.description: Provides bearings of the entrance and all passed roundabout exits. Adds the `exit_bearings` array to the step object in the response.

schedule.description: If true, return a public transport schedule starting at <departure> for the next <schedule_duration> minutes.

schedule_duration.description: The time window when requesting a public transport schedule. The format is passed as ISO 8601 duration: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

schedule_rows.description: The maximum amount of entries that should be returned when requesting a schedule.

skip_segments.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

items.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

alternative_routes.description: Specifies whether alternative routes are computed, and parameters for the algorithm determining suitable alternatives.

share_factor.description: Maximum fraction of the route that alternatives may share with the optimal route. The default value of 0.6 means alternatives can share up to 60% of path segments with the optimal route.

target_count.description: Target number of alternative routes to compute. Service returns up to this number of routes that fulfill the share-factor and weight-factor constraints.

weight_factor.description: Maximum factor by which route weight may diverge from the optimal route. The default value of 1.4 means alternatives can be up to 1.4 times longer (costly) than the optimal route.

alternative_routes.title: Alternative Routes

items.description: List of route attributes

bearings.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.
"Each pair is a comma-separated list that can consist of one or two float values, where the first value is the bearing and the second one is the allowed deviation from the bearing.
"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.
"The number of bearings corresponds to the length of waypoints-1 or waypoints. If the bearing information for the last waypoint is given, then this will control the sector from which the destination waypoint may be reached.
"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

items.description:
Specifies a list of pairs (bearings and deviations) to filter the segments of the road network a waypoint can snap to.
"For example `bearings=[[45,10],[120,20]]`.

"The bearing can take values between `0` and `360` clockwise from true north. If the deviation is not set, then the default value of `100` degrees is used.
"The number of pairs must correspond to the number of waypoints.

"You can skip a bearing for a certain waypoint by passing an empty value for an array, e.g. `[30,20],[],[40,20]`.

geometry_simplify.description: Specifies whether to simplify the geometry. Simplify geometry cannot be applied to routes with more than **one segment** and when `extra_info` is required.

ignore_transfers.description: Specifies if transfers as criterion should be ignored.

instructions_format.description: Select html for more verbose instructions.

maneuvers.description: Specifies whether the maneuver object is included into the step object or not.

maximum_speed.description: The maximum speed specified by user.

avoid_borders.description: Specify which type of border crossing to avoid

avoid_countries.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.

items.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.
Definition of the features to be avoided.

additionalProperties.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

avoid_polygons.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

profile_params.description: Specifies additional routing parameters. For all profiles except `driving-car`.

allow_unsuitable.description: Specifies if ways that might not be suitable (e.g. unknown pedestrian usage) should be included in finding routes - default false

restrictions.description: Describe restrictions to be applied to edges on the routing. any edges that do not match these restrictions are not traversed.

hazmat.description: Specifies whether to use appropriate routing for delivering hazardous goods and avoiding water protected areas. Default is `false`.

maximum_incline.description: Specifies the maximum incline as a percentage. `3`, `6` (default), `10`, `15.

maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in metres. Values are `0.03`, `0.06` (default), `0.1`.

minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres.

smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Default is `good`.

surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Default is `sett`.

track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Default is `grade1`.

surface_quality_known.description: Specifies whether to enforce that only ways with known information on surface quality be taken into account - default false

weightings.description: Describe additional weightings to be applied to edges on the routing.

green.description:
Specifies the Green factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the green routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through green areas over a shorter route.

quiet.description:
Specifies the Quiet factor for foot-* profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the quiet routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer quiet ways over a shorter route.

shadow.description:
Specifies the shadow factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the shadow routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through shadow areas over a shorter route.

steepness_difficulty.description:
Specifies the fitness level for `cycling-*` profiles.

 level: 0 = Novice, 1 = Moderate, 2 = Amateur, 3 = Pro. The prefered gradient increases with level.

seed.description: A seed to use for adding randomisation to the overall direction of the generated route

round_trip.title: Round Trip Route Options

radiuses.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

items.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

roundabout_exits.description: Provides bearings of the entrance and all passed roundabout exits. Adds the `exit_bearings` array to the step object in the response.

schedule.description: If true, return a public transport schedule starting at <departure> for the next <schedule_duration> minutes.

schedule_duration.description: The time window when requesting a public transport schedule. The format is passed as ISO 8601 duration: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

schedule_rows.description: The maximum amount of entries that should be returned when requesting a schedule.

skip_segments.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

items.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

suppress_warnings.description: Suppress warning messages in the response

walking_time.description: Maximum duration for walking access and egress of public transport. The value is passed in ISO 8601 duration format: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

coordinates.description: The waypoints to use for the route as an array of `longitude/latitude` pairs in WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)

items.description: The waypoints to use for the route as an array of `longitude/latitude` pairs in WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)
The waypoints to use for the route as an array of `longitude/latitude` pairs in WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)

elevation.description: Specifies whether to return elevation values for points. Please note that elevation also gets encoded for json response encoded polyline.

extra_info.description: The extra info items to include in the response

items.description: Specify which extra info items to include in the response

geometry_simplify.description: Specifies whether to simplify the geometry. Simplify geometry cannot be applied to routes with more than **one segment** and when `extra_info` is required.

id.description: Arbitrary identification string of the request reflected in the meta information.

ignore_transfers.description: Specifies if transfers as criterion should be ignored.

instructions_format.description: Select html for more verbose instructions.

maneuvers.description: Specifies whether the maneuver object is included into the step object or not.

maximum_speed.description: The maximum speed specified by user.

avoid_borders.description: Specify which type of border crossing to avoid

avoid_countries.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.

items.description: List of countries to exclude from matrix with `driving-*` profiles. Can be used together with `'avoid_borders': 'controlled'`. `[ 11, 193 ]` would exclude Austria and Switzerland. List of countries and application examples can be found [here](https://GIScience.github.io/openrouteservice/documentation/routing-options/Country-List.html). Also, ISO standard country codes cna be used in place of the numerical ids, for example, DE or DEU for Germany.
Definition of the features to be avoided.

additionalProperties.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

avoid_polygons.description: Comprises areas to be avoided for the route. Formatted in GeoJSON as either a Polygon or Multipolygon object.

profile_params.description: Specifies additional routing parameters. For all profiles except `driving-car`.

allow_unsuitable.description: Specifies if ways that might not be suitable (e.g. unknown pedestrian usage) should be included in finding routes - default false

restrictions.description: Describe restrictions to be applied to edges on the routing. any edges that do not match these restrictions are not traversed.

hazmat.description: Specifies whether to use appropriate routing for delivering hazardous goods and avoiding water protected areas. Default is `false`.

maximum_incline.description: Specifies the maximum incline as a percentage. `3`, `6` (default), `10`, `15.

maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in metres. Values are `0.03`, `0.06` (default), `0.1`.

minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres.

smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Default is `good`.

surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Default is `sett`.

track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Default is `grade1`.

surface_quality_known.description: Specifies whether to enforce that only ways with known information on surface quality be taken into account - default false

weightings.description: Describe additional weightings to be applied to edges on the routing.

green.description:
Specifies the Green factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the green routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through green areas over a shorter route.

quiet.description:
Specifies the Quiet factor for foot-* profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the quiet routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer quiet ways over a shorter route.

shadow.description:
Specifies the shadow factor for `foot-*` profiles.

factor: Multiplication factor range from 0 to 1. 0 is the shadow routing base factor without multiplying it by the manual factor and is already different from normal routing. 1 will prefer ways through shadow areas over a shorter route.

steepness_difficulty.description:
Specifies the fitness level for `cycling-*` profiles.

 level: 0 = Novice, 1 = Moderate, 2 = Amateur, 3 = Pro. The prefered gradient increases with level.

weightings.title: Profile Weightings

profile_params.title: Profile Parameters

round_trip.description: Specifies the parameters for generating round trip routes.

length.description: The target length of the route in `m` (note that this is a preferred value, but results may be different).

points.description: The number of points to use on the route. Larger values create more circular routes.

seed.description: A seed to use for adding randomisation to the overall direction of the generated route

round_trip.title: Round Trip Route Options

radiuses.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

items.description: A list of maximum distances (measured in metres) that limit the search of nearby road segments to every given waypoint. The values must be greater than 0, the value of -1 specifies using the maximum possible search radius. The number of radiuses correspond to the number of waypoints. If only a single value is given, it will be applied to all waypoints.

roundabout_exits.description: Provides bearings of the entrance and all passed roundabout exits. Adds the `exit_bearings` array to the step object in the response.

schedule.description: If true, return a public transport schedule starting at <departure> for the next <schedule_duration> minutes.

schedule_duration.description: The time window when requesting a public transport schedule. The format is passed as ISO 8601 duration: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

schedule_rows.description: The maximum amount of entries that should be returned when requesting a schedule.

skip_segments.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

items.description: Specifies the segments that should be skipped in the route calculation. A segment is the connection between two given coordinates and the counting starts with 1 for the connection between the first and second coordinate.

suppress_warnings.description: Suppress warning messages in the response

walking_time.description: Maximum duration for walking access and egress of public transport. The value is passed in ISO 8601 duration format: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations
